Hey Antonio -

I don't think there is really=
 that much of a difference or maybe I am
missing the point.  The concept of=
 User Interfaces (imho) is not as relevant
to this this particular discussi=
on I don't think beyond the fact that there
is an amount of intelligence th=
at resides outside of the user agent.  The
user agent/client is either a br=
owser or a machine.  The "end user" has to
provide inputs (interact with) t=
he user agents for something to happen in
either cases.  An end users inter=
action with a browser is obviously
"different" and possibly more dynamic bu=
t my machine could be dynamic with
reason depending on it interacts with it=
s user agent.

Eb
